citation.article-title: Dactylosporangium tropicum sp. nov., isolated from soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Dactylosporangium tropicum sp. nov.
Dactylosporangium tropicum [tro′pi.cum. L. neut. adj. tropicum tropical, of or pertaining to the tropic(s), relating to isolation from a tropical forest].
Gram-positive, mesophilic actinomycete that forms smooth-surfaced finger-shaped sporangia on short sporangiophores directly from the substrate hyphae.
Colonies are pale orange–yellow on ISP 2.
Each sporangium contains a row of ovoid motile spores.
Globose bodies are observed on modified soil extract agar and humic acid–vitamin agar.
Aerial mycelium is absent.
Spore surface appears smooth.
A pale-yellow soluble pigment is produced on ISP 2.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite.
Utilizes d-galactose, d-mannitol, glycerol and l-arabinose, weakly utilizes raffinose, but does not utilize cellobiose, d-fructose, melibiose, d-xylose, lactose or l-rhamnose.
Peptonization of milk and hydrolysis of starch are positive.
Gelatin liquefaction is negative.
Growth is optimum at 25–30 °C; no growth occurs above 40 °C.
The maximum NaCl concentration for growth is 3 % (w/v).
The cell wall contains glutamic acid, glycine, alanine and meso-diaminopimelic acid.
The acyl type of the cell wall is glycolyl.
The predominant menaquinones were MK-9(H8) and MK-9(H6).
The characteristic whole-cell sugars are galactose, glucose, mannose, rhamnose, ribose and xylose.
The phospholipid profile contains diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylinositol and phosphatidylethanolamine.

The fatty acids are iso-C16 : 0, anteiso-C17 : 0, iso-C15 : 0, anteiso-C15 : 0, iso-C17 : 0, C16 : 0, C17 : 0, C18 : 0, 10-methyl-C17 : 0, C15 : 0, iso-C14 : 0, 10-methyl-C16 : 0, 10-methyl-C18 : 0, C18 : 1ω9c and C17 : 1ω8c.
The G+C content of the type strain is 72.5 mol%.
The type strain is KB2-4T ( = BCC 34760T = JCM 15673T), isolated from soil near a hot spring in a tropical forest in Kanchanaburi Province, Thailand.
